Source.Description: Only show cases that don't have a case officer assigned.
Source.Label: no case officer

Source.Description: Only show cases that has case officer that does not have *case officer* role. Those cases can essentially be treated as if they have no case officer.
Source.Label: invalid case officer

Source.Description: This filter will show only deleted cases (cases can be deleted when client deletes them or when client changes their client node). Without this filter deleted cases will not show up in the results.
Source.Label: deleted carts only

CustomProperties.documentation: Cases from the child nodes won't be included.
The date when client created the cart. This is different from the date when the quotation was created.
Wambo ePO number.
Product id, code or name.
Either the # or the Contract # of a contract.
Contract's reference number by which this contract is known to clients and partner organizations.
7-digit contract number that will be sent to ERP when creating purchase orders.
Contract's reference number by which this contract is known to clients and partner organizations.
Catalogue name, code or tender reference.
Only active catalogues are visible on external site
7-digit contract number that will be sent to ERP when creating purchase orders.
Contract's reference number by which this contract is known to clients and partner organizations.
All new cases created under this client node will be auto-assigned to this case officer.

Service level defines the UNOPS fee charged to the client.

Default service level will only be used if the catalogue (from which a client procures products) does not defines its own service level.
If marked as "deactivated" the client node is effectively considered as non-existent.
All new cases created under this client node will be auto-assigned to this case officer.

Service level defines the UNOPS fee charged to the client.

Default service level will only be used if the catalogue (from which a client procures products) does not defines its own service level.
If marked as "deactivated" the client node is effectively considered as non-existent.
UNWB or OneUnops purchase order number.
The date when purchase order has been pushed to oneUNOPS.
oneUNOPS purchase order number
The date when purchase order has been pushed to oneUNOPS.

Inactive accounts won't be able to login into UNWB and use any of its functionality. Accounts are generally automatically deactivated after a period of inactivity. A deactivated account can be re-activated by the user themselves, by requesting a 're-activation' link which will be sent to their email (this can be done at the login stage).

If a user's account is disabled, then that user won't be able to login into UNWB and use any of its functionality. Disabled accounts will also not receive any email notifications. Disabled accounts can only be re-enabled by UNWB team.
User role or user type to look for.

If a user's account is disabled, then that user won't be able to login into UNWB and use any of its functionality. Disabled accounts will also not receive any email notifications. Disabled accounts can only be re-enabled by UNWB team.

Inactive accounts won't be able to login into UNWB and use any of its functionality. Accounts are generally automatically deactivated after a period of inactivity. A deactivated account can be re-activated by the user themselves, by requesting a 're-activation' link which will be sent to their email (this can be done at the login stage).
